org.certificateservices.custom.c2x.common.crypto

Class DefaultCryptoManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.certificateservices.custom.c2x.common.crypto.DefaultCryptoManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CryptoManager, Ieee1609Dot2CryptoManager

    public class DefaultCryptoManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements Ieee1609Dot2CryptoManager
    Default implementation of ITS CryptoManager with support for public key algorithms: ecdsa_nistp256_with_sha256 and ecies_nistp256

      • setupAndConnect

        public void setupAndConnect(CryptoManagerParams params)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                            java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                            java.security.NoSuchProviderException,
                            java.io.IOException,
                            BadCredentialsException,
                            java.security.SignatureException
        Initialized Bouncycastle and it's specific key factories
        Specified by:
        setupAndConnect in interface CryptoManager
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if supplied parameters contained invalid data.
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if required underlying cryptographic algorithms doesn't exist in JVM.
        java.security.NoSuchProviderException - if required cryptographic providers couldn't be found in JVM.
        java.io.IOException - if communication problems occurred with underlying components.
        BadCredentialsException - if supplied credentials wasn't successful when authentication towards underlying hardware.
        java.security.SignatureException - If internal problems occurred initializing the cryptomanager.

        Method to encrypt a symmetric key according to IEEE 1609.2 2017 specification.
        Specified by:
        ieeeEceisEncryptSymmetricKey2017 in interface Ieee1609Dot2CryptoManager
        Parameters:
        keyType - the algorithm specification of the recipients public key.
        encryptionKey - the recipients public key to encrypt to.
        symmetricKey - the symmetric key to encrypt (Should be AES 128)
        p1 - the deviation used as recipient information (SHA256 Hash of certificate or "" if no related certificate is available).
        Returns:
        a EncryptedDataEncryptionKey with v,c,t set.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if supplied parameters where invalid.
        java.security.GeneralSecurityException - if problems occurred performing the encryption.

      • ieeeEceisEncryptSymmetricKey2017

        public EncryptedDataEncryptionKey ieeeEceisEncryptSymmetricKey2017(EncryptedDataEncryptionKey.EncryptedDataEncryptionKeyChoices keyType,
                                                                   java.security.PublicKey encryptionKey,
                                                                   javax.crypto.SecretKey symmetricKey,
                                                                   byte[] p1,
                                                                   byte[] empericalPrivateKey)
                                                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                                   java.security.GeneralSecurityException
        Method to encrypt a symmetric key according to IEEE 1609.2 2017 specification.

        Important: this method should only be used when testing test vectors.

        Parameters:
        keyType - the algorithm specification of the recipients public key.
        encryptionKey - the recipients public key to encrypt to.
        symmetricKey - the symmetric key to encrypt (Should be AES 128)
        p1 - the deviation used as recipient information (SHA256 Hash of certificate or "" if no related certificate is available).
        empericalPrivateKey - use a specified empericalPrivate key, should only be used when testing predefiend test vector. And real use of ECIES encryption should specify null. Then a new key is generated for each call.
        Returns:
        a EncryptedDataEncryptionKey with v,c,t set.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if supplied parameters where invalid.
        java.security.GeneralSecurityException - if problems occurred performing the encryption.

      • ieeeEceisDecryptSymmetricKey2017

        public javax.crypto.SecretKey ieeeEceisDecryptSymmetricKey2017(EncryptedDataEncryptionKey encryptedDataEncryptionKey,
                                                               java.security.PrivateKey decryptionKey,
                                                               byte[] p1)
                                                        throws java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                                               java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                               java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException
        Method to decrypt symmetric key using the 1609.2 2017 defined ECIES encryption scheme.
        Specified by:
        ieeeEceisDecryptSymmetricKey2017 in interface Ieee1609Dot2CryptoManager
        Parameters:
        encryptedDataEncryptionKey - the type of encryption key.
        decryptionKey - the receiver's private key.
        p1 - the deviation used as recipient information (SHA256 Hash of certificate or "" if no related certificate is available).
        Returns:
        the decrypted AES symmetric key.
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - if supplied private key was invalid
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if invalid arguments where specified.
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - if invalid key specification was given.

                                                              java.security.SignatureException
        Description copied from interface: Ieee1609Dot2CryptoManager
        Method to construct the private key related to a generate certificate, given the related r value.
        Specified by:
        reconstructImplicitPrivateKey in interface Ieee1609Dot2CryptoManager
